attributes.action: Make train operators legally provide adjustments for passengers with autism.
attributes.background: People with autistic spectrum disorder (ASD) experience sensory difficulties. Train operators are failing to provide or enforce, quiet carriages, or other areas free of noise, distraction or bright lights. Passengers with hidden disabilities deserve adjustments too. We demand a statory requirement.
attributes.additional_details: Passengers with autism are being forced to sit on the carpet between carriages, challenge other passengers, to get distressed, go into meltdown or experience anxiety, simply because train operators won't cater for their needs. Complaints are dismissed and excuses such as availability, company policy are trotted out by train companies. The Equality Act is not being enforced for those with hidden disabilities and sensory impairments. We demand a new statutory duty for compliance and adjustments.

attributes.action: Payments to carers should be increased significantly.
attributes.background: Carers should be paid a decent living wage and not the pittance of £62.50 per week. Carers save the Government, billions of pounds a year. If all carers just gave up then there would not just be a crisis but total meltdown of social care. Carers should be cared for by the Government.

attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to walk a dog in a public place without a lead on
attributes.background: I am seeing a lot of dog attacks lately that could have been avoided if the dog was on a lead. I think it should be the law that all dogs are on a lead in a public place

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Raise the Speed limit on Motorways in the UK from 70mph to 90mph.
attributes.background: The 70mph speed limit on UK motorways was introduced in 1966. since then the technology and safety features of cars has come on considerably. it is now time to embrace this change and accept that it is safe for cars to drive at this speed. it will also help to reduce congestion on motorways.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: Put a statue of Diane Abbott MP in the Palace of Westminster's Central Lobby.
attributes.background:
A full sized bronze statue should be commissioned and placed in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster to honour Diane Abbott MP.
As the first black woman to have a seat in the House of Commons and a faithful public servant she is an inspiration to us all; astonishingly resilient and brave.

attributes.action: Acknowledge 'secondary modern' schools are created by grammar schools.
attributes.background: The government want to create new grammar schools but say 'secondary modern' schools will not exist. Schools surrounding grammar schools can not contain a full range of pupils of all abilities, this means they are are not truly 'comprehensive' schools. I want this difference officially acknowledged.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 163 grammar schools selecting high ability pupils and 400/500 schools with low/medium ability pupil intakes as a result. These 'secondary modern' schools can not perform in the same way as a comprehensive school when the balance of pupils is so different.

Please sign this petition to ask the Department for Education to identify these schools and classify them as 'secondary moderns' or similar new name. This will help us research these schools properly before there are more.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: To cease Brexit negotiations until there is a drop in racially motivated crimes.
attributes.background: Racially motivated crimes appear to have increased in this country. The Government need to halt all Brexit negotiations until there is a substantial drop in racial and xenophobic hate crimes and issue an immediate statement of 'zero tolerance'

attributes.action: Restrict Rail Franchise Owners paying excessive dividends when performance fails
attributes.background:
Some Train Operating Companies have fallen far short of their Public Performance Measures (PPM).

Simultaneously Franchise Owners - such as the Go Ahead Group - continue to pay material dividends that offer investors an attractive yield (e.g. 4-5%) which is 10 to 20 times the typical savings rate.
attributes.additional_details:
The PPM of the GoVia Thameslink Group (Southern, GEX and TL) is around 70% in 2016 so far - against the target for of around 86%. One in 3 trains is late.

The service that funds their dividends has failed to meet acceptable standards, and annual fare increases continue to be applied which contribute to that dividend.

This petition seeks to apply legislation that forces Franchise Owners to limit dividend distribution when PPM and other measures fall materially, and serially, short of target.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinckley C
attributes.background:
Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinkley C

I have no in principle objection to nuclear power. Neither do I wish to comment on cost, no-one on the planet knows whether the strike price will be good bad or indifferent in 10, 20 or 30 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly we do not know if it will work! There is no working version to base a decision on. What if in 8 years we find it doesn't? We will have a serious problem.

Second, EDF will come under huge pressure to make it work and make it work by 2025, what short cuts might they be tempted to perform as a consequence?

Finally, the world political scene is unclear for the next 5 years let alone 30+ years, we simply should not put the energy production for our country in the hands of other countries.

attributes.action: Delay the April 2017 VED (Car Tax) changes until a better idea is proposed
attributes.background: The 2017 changes will damage the car industry and buyer of both new and used cars from April 2017. The changes do nothing to encourage manufacturers to improve efficiency and do nothing to encourage buyers to buy more fuel and emissions efficient cars. Changes are a retrograde step
attributes.additional_details:
The details of the new rates are available on gov website - https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/534511/ved-reform-briefing-for-motor-industry.pdf
This change increases costs for drivers ;
First year tax from £0 for cars between 1 and 130g/km CO2 to between £10 and £160.  
It increases annual cost for these cars from £20-£110 to £140 for all
Adds a £310 premium on top where list price is over £40,000. This lasts 5 years so affects the used car market also.

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: BLUE BADGES SHOULD BE GIVEN TO PEOPLE WHO ARE AUTISTIC
attributes.background: AUTISM SHOULD BE AN ELIGIBLE DISABILITY FOR A BLUE BADGE

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Introduce rent caps on private let & prevent landlords refusing Housing Benefit
attributes.background: Currently in the SE private rents have become ridiculous, with  a single room costing as much as £700 pm. This is useless to a largely working class area. To add to this most letting agents and landlords refuse to accept any form of housing benefit, even as a top up.
attributes.additional_details: I would as that we stop the practice of refusing to accept tenants with housing benefit and ask that we put caps on how much rent can be charged. £1400 pm for a house is impossibly high! This requires you to be earning £34,000 and pay almost £3000 up front (figures on a recent viewing of a property) The average UK wage of £26,500 would not cover this. We have houses. People simply cannot afford them! I would also ask they they stop houses being split into rooms for rental reducing family homes.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: Ban homework in the UK
attributes.background: The children do plenty of work in school
attributes.additional_details: How are they supposed to eat, hang out with friends, do school clubs, bathe and get 8 hours of sleep when they have so much homework?

attributes.action: Raise pay for regular and reserve armed forces personnel
attributes.background: Our armed forces are underpaid and over worked we think that there minimum pay should be raised not just for regulars but also reserve units aswell
attributes.additional_details: I am an ex regular soldier and a serving reserve soldier in the army and I've seen first hand the state some of my muckers have been in having to budget for everything while risking there life if needs must to protect the uk and her inhabitants

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Fully regulate Counselling and Psychotherapy, to properly protect the public.
attributes.background:
Anyone can call themselves "counsellor" or "psychotherapist", even with no qualifications at all.

Such people are a potentially fatal danger to clients, yet are currently free to practise.

There are societies to belong to, accreditations to gain and registers to join, but all are optional.
attributes.additional_details:
Successive governments have promised to regulate counselling for over a decade, but none have done so.

The "Accredited Register" scheme was created in 2013, and is like "CORGI" for counsellors. It sets minimum standards of training, insurance etc. However, you don't have to join a register and clients do not necessarily even know of its existence.

Regulation would protect the titles "counsellor" and "psychotherapist" and prevent those who do not meet minimum safety standards from practising.

attributes.action: Screening and training for mobility scooters especially for class 3
attributes.background: There are 300,000 mobility users in England and Wales. There were 208 accidents in 2014-2015, 46 serious injuries, and 9 deaths. Class 3 mobility scooters can use the road up to 8mph, need TAX and at present, only voluntary insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
Training is needed for cars and motorcycles that use the highways but no training is needed for mobility scooters. AM Hefin David and AM Julie Morgan are in agreement that training should be given. Compulsory training will help reduce accident rates and make the users more confident and independent which will help with well-being. Statistics are being looked into to make insurance mandatory but not training. ROSPA say training should be given but not necessary!

Screening should also be done by a doctor or medical professional before buying a mobility scooter. This will ensure that people have the physical and mental capacity required to safely use a scooter, such as adequate vision.

attributes.action: Bring March into the light
attributes.background: Simple as this - put the clocks forward at the end of Feb instead of March.  It'll still be bright for the morning commute & school run and we'll gain an hour on the evenings, shortening those winter blues. It'll be good for the economy too. Win Win!

attributes.action: Make the A420 between Oxford and Swindon a dual carriageway.
attributes.background: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor
attributes.additional_details: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of UK Nationals resident in other EU states will not change.
attributes.background: As a matter of urgency we call upon the UK government to unambiguously commit to guarantee any ‘Brexit deal’ will ensure all rights currently enjoyed by UK nationals resident in other EU states prior to the triggering of article 50 will remain unchanged.
attributes.additional_details: According to UN estimates 1.2 million UK Citizens have exercised their right as EU citizens to move permanently to other EU states. In many cases, if not most, entire lives are now in adoptive countries. Businesses have been opened, property has been purchased, children have been enrolled in local schools. Many such individuals were denied a voice in the Brexit vote due residency status abroad and / or errors of the electoral committee.

attributes.action: Government should not delay initiating secession because of Germans and French
attributes.background:
Delaying Article 50 because of German and French General Elections in 2017 is a political ruse on the part of Theresa May as the negotiations will not be affected by either result.

There is no reason why negotiations cannot start because a change will be to our advantage and make them easier.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, the two most formidable opponents of Britain in any post Brexit deal will be Merkel and Hollande.  That is the worst case scenario.

If Merkel is displaced, it will likely be by the election of candidates from the AfD.  If Hollande is displaced, it will likely be by the Front Nationale.  In both cases, they are highly Eurosceptical Parties and therefore unlikely to make it difficult for a British withdrawal. They are far more likely to give a good deal for us than at present.

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase ‘up to’ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: Create a Fast Track immigration counter for UK BRP Card Holders at UK airports.
attributes.background: UK residents with a valid BRP card / visa should be allowed to use the fast track service at airports to enter the country apart from using the usual immigration counter.

attributes.action: Abolish Bedroom Tax on all Council Properties
attributes.background: This Bedroom Tax is affecting thousands of families all across the UK, when it was originally imposed there was a lot of debate to abolish it and yet this has not been done.
attributes.additional_details:
This affects everyone living in social housing; disabled, welfare recipients, and those who work. If you live in a council property and have any spare bedrooms, you will be forced to pay the tax whatever your personal situation may be; even if you have lived in that property for up to 22 years. 

The government has decided that:

* Any single person aged 16 or over needs their own bedroom.
* A couple need a bedroom.
* A child needs a bedroom BUT.....
* A boy and a girl are expected to share a bedroom if they are both under 10.
* 2 boys or 2 girls are expected to share if they are both under 16. See below for examples.
* Foster children are not taken into account 
* Children who stay with you part of the time aren’t taken into account.

attributes.action: Make sign language compulsory from infants at school.
attributes.background: Anyone can become deaf in their lifetime. Surely if more people can sign language people that are deaf or people with special needs adhd or autism that use forms of signs such as makaton to communicate won't feel so isolated.
attributes.additional_details: Children are like a sponge when soaking up knowledge. So if makaton which is an easier form.of sign language is introduced to children at a young age, it would mean that we would eventually all be able to.communicate at some point in life with someone who uses sign language every day. It means future generations can go ask that child thats sat on their own in the playground to come and play with them. They will be able to.communicate, instead of not knowing how to and the child not left isolated no more.

attributes.action: Suspend hospital fines for breaches in 4h waits in Emergency Departments
attributes.background: The Standard Contract for NHS Providers in 2015-16 charges hospitals £120 for every breach of the 4h wait times over the target in Emergency Departments. With unprecedented pressure on Emergency Departments currently this is an absurd system of punishing hospitals for being busy.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Health Committee "Winter pressure in accident and emergency departments Third Report of Session 2016–17" demonstrates that compliance with 4h targets plummets every winter (85% in 2015, 80% in 2016) and demand is currently higher than ever. Hospitals are paying the price of chronic government underfunding of Primary Care and Community Care, and to financially penalise hospitals for flawed government policy is clearly absurd.

attributes.action: demolish Devolution powers in the UK
attributes.background: I am petitioning to get rid of Devolution powers in the UK as it has failed. All powers should be returned to Westminster for the good of the UK union

attributes.action: Owners of UK media should be registered to vote and pay taxes within the UK.
attributes.background: Our democracy requires balanced and accountable news media. Part of the 'fit and proper person' test for owning a significant portion of our media should be that they are eligible to vote and pay taxes, so that they, like the rest of us, are fully part of the political environment they help shape.

attributes.action: Dogs to be kept on leads whilst on sports fields
attributes.background:
On ongoing issue in our society is dog walkers allowing their dogs to run freely over sporting pitches, i.e rugby, football, cricket...
At times these dogs will release on the pitches and owners will ignore the excrement and not pick it up, thus providing a huge risk to those who play on them
attributes.additional_details:
Sporting pitches experience usage from a variety of different people - the problem of dog walkers allowing their dogs to be off their lead is that they are free to excrement wherever, the majority of the time, without the owner knowing.
The danger of this on sporting pitches is that it increases the risk of a child or adult getting the faeces in their eyes leading to several physical and health risks such as going blind.

Please help stop this and provide some respect for our sportsman.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for shops to tell customers that they sell real fur
attributes.background: Many people believe that the fur industry is a thing of the past and is no longer 'fashionable,' however this is far from the truth. While it has been illegal since 2002 to farm animals for fur in the UK, it is still able to be imported, making it a £500 million industry in the UK every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.animalaid.org.uk/images/pdf/factfiles/fur.pdf

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/25/faux-fur-or-real_n_8648146.html

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-wear/fur-trade/

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Ask retailers to not automatically issue receipts but instead give us an option.
attributes.background:
It is estimated that 12 BILLION receipts are issued in the UK alone each year and most end up in the bin.
By opting to not have your receipt you could help save Rainforests from deforestation, reduce waste, reduce oil and water consumption and help conserve this planet. Retailers also reduce costs.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no requirement under the sale and supply of goods act 1994 act to supply a receipt to prove that a contract exists between buyer and seller, nor is there any requirement to provide physical evidence of any kind, except for the faulty goods/purchase. 

Retailers would also save thousands of pounds in reduced costs.

attributes.action: Exempt all properties with a broadband speed <10 Mbps from Council Tax
attributes.background: Broadband is an essential service, but due to local and central government decisions, many millions of people do not have sufficient access.  A lack of good broadband makes property unsaleable, i.e. essentially worthless, and so should not be subject to Council Tax.
attributes.additional_details: Various government initiatives have failed to provide the necessary service to all, indeed they have been specifically excluded from the programmes.  The option to move is not available with low speeds, and this disadvantage should be recompensed through exemption from Council Tax.  The USO is still some years away, by which time further improvements in speed will be required,  Therefore, the 10Mbps rate should double every 2 years in line with Nielsen's Law of Internet Bandwidth.

attributes.action: Change divorce law! Make "no fault" divorce possible.
attributes.background: No one wants to encourage a break up. But if couples talk the D-word, it is because the marriage is over. We need a simpler, administrative process that keeps kids safe and won't break the bank. It needs to help people, so they can put their kids first!
attributes.additional_details:
The law says you have to either divorce by waiting 2 years or 5 years OR you have to choose a reason like "adultery" or "unreasonable behaviour" or "desertion". 
"Why should it be easy? Kids need their parents to stay together" I hear you say...The trouble is, lawyers get round the divorce law very easily, but at great expense to their clients. Letters about petitions back and forth, outrage at the particulars, common sense out the window. ££££ for lawyers. Madness! Sign the petition to help.

attributes.action: To grant leave to remain in the UK for my wife whom I'm married for 26 years.
attributes.background: I married to my wife a Singapore citizen for 26 years and have two children born in the UK and I am a UK citizen, we submitted many application over 18 years for Visa for my wife to remain in the UK but all was rejected(6 in all)After many tries and different forms the application is rejected again.
attributes.additional_details: I have medical problems and had two operations in 3 months and need someone to look after me and also suffering from depression.I have wasted most of my savings paying for the applications and recent application had to be submitted with medical insurance and the price has gone up for new applications.My family life has been ruined because of this and my kids grew up not knowing their mother well.We have a grandchild who was born April of this year.We have a right to be together.
